episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky historical and cultural facts, including the use of sausage dogs in Roman Coliseum shows, the frequent appearances of Tutankhamun at 1920s seances, the legendary abilities attributed to Pythagoras, and a list of the fattiest foods from different US states.

facts.fact: Some shows at the Roman Coliseum featured sausage dogs.
In the 1920s, spiritualists started complaining that Tutankhamun was appearing at their seances too often.

According to his various biographers, Pythagoras could talk with animals, be in two places at once, had a shiny golden leg, and was able to tell fishermen the exact number of fish they'd caught in their net just by looking at it.
When the website health.com listed the fattiest foods in every state in the US, entrants included North Carolina's liver mush, New York's garbage plate, and Indiana's fried brain sandwich.
